New Records: Rachin Ravindra became NZ's youngest World Cup centurion at 23
Ravindra is also the fastest Kiwi to make a World Cup hundred
Key Match Events: Devon Conway made a career-best 152* while Ravindra scored 123* to lead NZ to a 9-wicket win
Sam Curran took 1/47 in 6 overs for England
Matt Henry took 3/48 in 10 overs for NZ
Pre-Game Insights: England were aiming for around 330 but were well below par
Jos Buttler thought the pitch skidded on better under lights but they played a long way short of their best
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler said it was a disappointing day and they were outplayed by NZ
Tom Latham praised the partnership between Conway and Ravindra and said they adapted to the conditions beautifully
Miscellaneous Highlights: NZ won the toss and limited England to 282/9
Conway and Ravindra's partnership was the key to NZ's win
Ravindra was named the Player of the Match
